lines.text: mountain tops, poetry, and songs by Bing Crosby!
Quick, hide in here.
You gotta be kidding me.
Don't leave, Frosty.
Don't worry, kid, I'll be back. Just give me some time to find a new bowtie. This time no polka dots, maybe green or blue. I like blue. Brings out my eyes.
It's the greatest invention since microwave pancakes!
My dad says snow causes heart attacks.
He must have snow confused with chili dogs. Any other questions?
What do you say we find a safer place to talk, like Siberia?
This is my friend Charles.
Nice to meet you. I take it he doesn't dance... Doesn't blink much either.
It's no winter wonderland when you're skidding into a telephone pole!
Holly? Oh, there you are! You locked your best friend in a box and just ran off. Now how are you going to feel when poor Charles grows up and has to join a support group?
What are you looking for?
Batteries.
Lighten up, kid. Some things just can't be explained, like rhythm.
[starts snapping his fingers]
Hold it, stop the car. Stop the car! And stop the music!
Quiet down, now, quiet down! Where do you think you are, MTV?
Removing snow's a breeze with one blast of Summer Wheeze. I want those words printed on billboards, buses, large dogs!

[sees the Summer Wheeze trucks pass by and spray the snow away]
Oh, no!
Don't get upset, Frosty.

Upset? "Upset" is waking up and finding out somebody forgot to give you a belly button. "Upset" is finding out somebody stole your nose to play foosball! This ain't "upset", kid! This is PANIC! I'm 2 squirts from being HISTORY!
I've been going to the winter carnival since I was knee-high to a snow cone.
You better think fast, guys, or else I'm going back to the North Pole in a bowl.
One friend is a lot different than no friends. One friend is plenty.

Holly didn't sleep a wink that night, neither did Frosty. Beansborough had suddenly become a scary place at least to a happy-go-lucky guy like Frosty, who thought wearing no socks in January was living dangerously. Holly knew she had to do something fast if she wanted to protect Frosty.
[first lines]
snowflakes. I know it's not for everyone, but as long as you pack light, I mean, and wear at least three layers of undies, it's a lovely way to spend the winter.
[last lines]

And so the folks of Beansborough got their winter carnival after all. A tradition was saved. Summer Wheeze was permanently canned, and Mr. Twitchell decided to make sleds instead of trouble. He should have known he was no match for Mother Nature or a little girl like Holly. Next stop, Winnipeg. Nice town, plenty of parking space, and lots of cocoa.

[as Holly tries to get her hat off his head]
Oh no, you don't. If you want something, take the tie, unless you think I need it.

[seeing Holly's turkey leg sticking out from her desk]
Holly, what is that sticking out of your desk?
It's - just my lunch. Turkey.
Don't you think you should cook it first?
